name: Scrapple
author: KCFOXY
summary: Originally of Pennsylvania Dutch origin, scrapple was made from the bits and pieces of the pig not suited for anything else! This streamlined recipe takes only minutes to prepare ... perfect for making the night before.  Serve topped with choice of warmed syrup.
ingredients: ⅛ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
directions: Place sausage in a large, deep skillet
Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown
Drain and rinse in colander under cold water, breaking sausage into pea sized pieces
Return to skillet along with the condensed milk, and heat over medium until just bubbling
Immediately stir in the cornmeal and pepper and reduce heat to simmer
Continue cooking, 5 minutes total; mush will be stiff
Pack into 8x4 loaf pan, cover and chill overnight
To serve, cut into 1/4 to 1/2 inch slices and saute until golden in nonstick skillet
